Thatâ€™s exactly what went down at Brandonâ€™s birthday bash at Iron Axe Bar & Grill in South Daytona. Savor Delicious Food and Drinks at Iron Axe Bar and Grill We kicked things off with drinks and ordered some food while our server, who doubled as our axe-throwing coach, laid down the rules and gave us some much-needed tips. I opted for the hand-cut dry-aged ribeye and fried green tomatoes, expecting typical bar fare. I was pleasantly surprised â€“ the steak was on point, and those fried green tomatoes made for a great start to the night. The Mrs. loved the mac and cheese and has been raving about it ever since. Then it was time to get competitive. My wife and I both have competitive spirits and always enjoy a good challenge. We split into teams, and the game was on. Every bullseye got us roaring with cheers, while the misses were met with endless chuckles and smack talk from the other team. We had people there who were ready to go and some more timid than others, but by the end of the night, everyone participated, and we made it a night to remember. And dare I say, the girls actually ended up being better than the guys! Each lane is rented by the hour. You can also easily reserve a spot online and add up to six people per lane. Games are projected onto the wood, giving you different targets during different games and lighting up when you hit a bullseye. Donâ€™t forget to wear closed toed shoes! That is a must if you want to participate. Axe Throwing Tips and Tricks For anyone new to axe throwing, here are a few tips that really helped me: First, your grip matters â€“ hold the axe like youâ€™re shaking hands with it, firm but not too tight. For your stance, keep your feet shoulder width apart and your weight slightly forward. If youâ€™re right-handed, step forward with your left foot as you throw and keep everything lined up with the target. The key is in the release â€“ start with the axe high over your head, swing it down smoothly, and let go when itâ€™s parallel to the target. You want it to rotate just once before it sticks. And remember, consistency is crucial. Itâ€™s not about power but getting that smooth throw every time. Donâ€™t forget the follow-through! Enjoy More Games: Cornhole, Darts, and Giant Jenga Iron Axe Bar and Grill isnâ€™t just about axe throwing. Theyâ€™ve got cornhole, darts, and giant Jenga if you need a break from the throwing action. The vibe is chill but with plenty of energy. Itâ€™s the kind of place where you can be competitive without taking things too seriously. The staff kept everything running smoothly, making sure we were all having a blast and jumping in with tips when needed. It was a great space to throw a party â€“ no pun intended! You donâ€™t have to reserve a space if you pick a slower day and time of the week. We chose Monday at 6:30 p.m. We arrived a couple of minutes early and placed balloons and noisemakers out to â€œreserveâ€ our spot. If youâ€™re looking for a spot to relax, play some games, and enjoy great company, Iron Axe is definitely worth a visit. A big shoutout to Brandon and everyone who joined in â€“ you made it a day to remember! Bobby Gâ€¦ out! IRON AXE BAR AND GRILL IronAxeBar.com (386) 238-9170 2842 S Ridgewood Avenue South Daytona, FL 32119 Scotty Sudakis AKA Bobby G is a freelance writer and frontman in 5 Time Shag. About - IronAxe Skip to content Home Book Now Scorecard Waivers Safety Leagues About Privacy Policy Hamburger Toggle Menu IAS A Big Business Starts Small About Us IAS History How We Started Our Story Discover the captivating world of axe throwing at Iron Axe Society. Our passionate founders were instantly smitten with this thrilling sport. They, along with their dedicated circle of family and friends, poured their expertise and effort into transforming a space within the historic Gibson Mill into the first venue in Concord NC dedicated to the sport. As a proudly local, owner-operated establishment, Iron Axe Society is your premier destination for the hottest indoor sports trend. Whether you're an amateur, recreational enthusiast, or a seasoned professional, our facility caters to all levels of axe throwing expertise. We welcome ages 8 year of age and older to join us for an unforgettable experience in the heart of our community! "We tried axe throwing because it looked fun, got hooked because we're competitive, and opened a venue because we love the community. The acceptance, sportmanship, and comradery in axe throwing is unlike any sport either of us have ever competed in." ~ Ashlyn & Frank - Owners 1st Perfect Game ~ in League Sep. 23, 2023 ~ "I had hit several perfect games, even on video. Finally... I got one in league." 1st Perfect Game Ever Oct. 22, 2023 ~ "This was truly my first ever... and I didn't even know I was on track for a perfect game." Why Choose Us Indoor Arena Beat the heat, or warm up from the cold. Our arena is open year-round and provides an invitingly comfortable environment. Trained staff Our staff are safety-trained and know how to give you the tools and resources needed for a fun time. Beverages for All We offer beer and wine for those of you who enjoy the spirits, along with an assorted line of Pepsi products and energy drinks. Discounts We proudly offer military, first responder, and law enforcement discounts with proper ID. 

Thank you for your service to  our Nation and our Community! Team Building What better way to say "hey you're my friend" than throwing a chunk of steel at a wooden target?
